speaker: Alice
content: 3 days after my funeral, Lynette replaced her grief with a much more useful emotion - Indignation.
mark: replace sth with sth 用…… 替换……；以…… 取代……

speaker: Lynette
content: Tom, this is my fifth message and you still haven't called me back. Well, you must be having a lot of fun on your business trip, I can only imagine.
mark: I can only imagine 我只能想象；我只能设想

speaker: Lynette
content: Well, guess what? The kids and I want to have some fun, too. So unless you call me back by noon, We are getting on a plane and joining you.
mark: guess what? 猜猜看；你猜怎么着
get on a plane 登上飞机；上飞机

speaker: Lynette
content: Not now, honey. Mommy's threatening Daddy. Where are your brothers?
mark: threaten v. 威胁，恐吓；危及

speaker: Lynette
content: Crap. Natalie Klein. I don't believe it.
mark: crap 胡扯，废话；蹩脚货，废物；

speaker: Klein
content: Lynette. How long has it been?

speaker: Lynette
content: Years. How are you? How's the firm?

speaker: Klein
content: Good. Everyone misses you. We all say if you hadn't quit, you'd be running the place by now.
mark: 虚拟语气：过去完成时hadn’t done表示 “与过去事实相反的假设，would be doing现在进行时的虚拟。
be running the place 管理这个地方

speaker: Klein
content: So, how's domestic life? Don't you just love being a mom?
mark: domestic 家用的，家庭的； 国内的，本国的；

speaker: Alice
content: And there it was, the question that Lynette always dreaded.

speaker: Alice
content: For those who asked it, only one answer was acceptable. So Lynette responded as she always did. She lied.

speaker: Lynette
content: Well, to be honest, It's the best job I've ever had.
mark: to be honest 老实说；说实话
It's the best job I've ever had. 这是我做过的最好的工作。
It's the best job I've never had. 这是我从未有过的最好的工作。
这两句话的区别在于，第一句话是对已经拥有的工作的评价，而第二句话是对尚未拥有的工作的期望。
